Reviews.Title: Simply a good camera
Reviews.Author: Rocky Baker
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I own five Point and Shoot cameras. This camera is good simply because it isn't bad. In many P & S cameras there are so many things set by the camera software the user can't make important manual adjustments. Not the case here. For example, I shoot in Program mode and I select the ISO and the exposure compensation. Many P&S; cameras don't have a P mode. The monitor is plenty big. There are plenty of megapixels. The buttons stand out enough to be easy to push. The picture quality is good. The camera looks good and feels solid and well made. I really like a viewfinder even on a P&S; camera and this Olympus doesn't have one, so I give the camera 4 stars rather than 5 stars. But there is nothing wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not the best for photos
Reviews.Author: Charles Hathaway
Reviews.Content: I've been very impressed with the video functions and video quality of this camera, but not as impressed with the photo functions - actually, I only have one issue with it. You can't adjust the shutter speed. You can adjust the "exposure" level, which effects the shutter speed, but you can only adjust the exposure between stops -2 and +2. I suspect this is the main reason people have trouble with getting too many blurry pictures with this camera. It adjusts the shutter speed first, then the f-stop or ISO if necessary. The average shutter speed it uses is between 40 and 80, even when you use the flash (even taking still life at that speed, you probably want to use a tripod to avoid blur).One way to compensate for the low (blurry) shutter speed is to turn the exposure level to the lowest possible, and then use the flash. That makes the camera speed go up to about 125 - fast enough for average pictures, but kind of tough if you are catching wiggly kids. This isn't as much of a problem in high sunlight. It will take 400 or 500 speed photos out there.It claims to be able to go up to 2000 speed, but I suspect the only way it ever would is if you turned the exposure level to +2 and took a zoomed in picture of the sun.This would be an awesome camera if it allowed you to manually adjust the shutter speed however you want. So if your focus in getting a camera is good simple video function, go for it, but if you're wanting to take good photos, go with a different camera - one that at least ALLOWS manual shutter speed adjusting.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: FE-47 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD - EAI was not happy about this product, but I think mine was defective and I returned it.  The pictures were terrible in normal room light they look extremely blurry like the simulated drinking driving public service announcement on TV.  Outside pictures were blurry too, but much better than normal room light.  I have a nine year old Olympus 3.7 MP camera that out performs this new 14MP Olympus, but again I think mine was defective.

Reviews.Title: Olympus fe-47 14 mp digital camera
Reviews.Author: joyce meggs
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying my camera.  It works out really good for me.  I am going to upgrade later, maybe by my birthday.

Reviews.Title: Average pic quality but solidly built and takes 2 AA batteries
Reviews.Author: Gadgester "No Time, No Money"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1J7Q5JMPHCYNCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1J7Q5JMPHCYNCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:13 MinsVideo clip note: my video clip demonstrates digital zoom in video mode. (sorry about the cough as I was sick at the time.)Review:After an auto accident I decided to get an inexpensive digital camera and keep it in my car. At first I bought a Vivitar for about 50 bucks from my local Walgreen's but it was a complete POS and ate through batteries like crazy. Then I saw this Olympus FE-47 at my local OfficeMax store (about 4 months ago) for only 79 dollars. I tried it out and decided to get it.So this camera should sell for no more than 80 dollars. I've seen it at other local stores for $80 or less.It's a compact camera that has 14 megapixels of resolution and 5x optical zoom. Since Olympus is a camera maker, the FE-47 has a good Olympus-branded lens. Obviously it's not top-notch, at this price, but its optics is better than much more expensive cameras from off-brands like GE or Samsung. The picture quality is actually pretty good; the only "fault" is the contrast tends to be a little flat, while most consumers would prefer more contrast. Of course, this can be easily "fixed" in software. (I put quotes here because professionals would prefer flat-contrast files because they can then rework those files however they like; too much contrast loses optical information which cannot be recovered.)Pictures taken on the camera are generally sharp and clear, thanks to the good optics. Shutter delay is about average for a camera in this class. Now, to be honest, I was pretty happy with the FE-47's picture quality until I bought a Panasonic Lumix DMC-S3 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (White) for just $20 more (from Costco) a month later. That camera has high picture quality, judiciously higher (but not too high) contrast, and better saturation; in other words, the Panny S3's pictures come out more pleasant to the eye. Plus the Panny is even smaller, lighter, and better built. So I ended up putting the FE-47 where I had intended it to be: in my car's glove compartment. And I carry my S3 everywhere I go.One interesting "feature" of the FE-47 is, it can optically zoom but when you choose this option, there is no audio recording. Alternatively, you can turn on audio recording in video mode, but then there is no optical zoom, only digital. My video clip shows the digital zoom with sound option. My guess is the FE-47 is so cheaply built that the engineers didn't want to expend extra effort on silencing the zoom motor. As you can see from my video clip, even on a beautiful day as it was, digital zoom sucks. Highest video quality is VGA (640x480) at 30fps, i.e., DVD quality.The FE-47 is generally easy to use, and there are many options to set. It's compatible with SD and SDHC cards, and it uses only 2 AA batteries -- either alkaline or rechargeable NiMH will do fine. I use Sanyo NEW 1500 eneloop 8 Pack AA Ni-MH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries because they retain power much longer than regular NiMH batteries -- even longer than alkalines! There is a setting in the camera menu where you indicate whether you've put in alkaline or NiMH (on the last setup screen). Be sure to select the correct type so the camera can report remaining battery accurately.Overall, I think the FE-47 is a pretty good inexpensive camera. It has good optics and picture quality. Shutter lag is average which means it can be a bit of a problem when you need to capture fast-fleeting moments. But it uses 2 AA batteries and battery life is quite good. Optical zoom without sound in video is weird but at least it's an option (no optical zoom in the Panny S3's video mode at all). If you can get this for $80 or less, it's a good deal. And I personally think everyone should own one digicam that takes AA batteries, whether you travel abroad or not.Check the picture gallery for my sample photos, all untouched and taken casually.

Reviews.Title: Better off with a CVS disposable
Reviews.Author: solana35
Reviews.Content: I took three rounds of pictures, 80% of which came out blurry. I tried every possible combination of camera settings, including the reduce hand-shake setting, and got these results. I even rested my elbow on the arm of a chair. The remaining 20% are not what I would ever call "crisp." The person at Customer Service was very nice... but I had to call Customer Service. Even after investing a few hours in reading the user's manual to be able to use it, I returned the camera. I used a CVS disposable camera, instead, for my vacation--with perfect results.

Reviews.Title: Junk camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Burgess
Reviews.Content: The camera is one of 4 that I have purches all have had the screen to burn or discolor----Junk and I really like most Olympus cameras.

Reviews.Title: Got Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mumaugh
Reviews.Content: i purchase the Olympus Fe-47 for quick shots without much fuss.  I am very pleased with the camera size and options and there are few buttons to worry about.  This camera was just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Does what it does
Reviews.Author: J. Statham
Reviews.Content: The camera does all the things it is designed to do. Ease of operation, stores to memory reasonably quick, not a lot of waiting like in my old camera. You can view and scroll through your shots w/o a lot of button pushing and return to shoot. The zoom responds well as does the flash. The batteries seem to last longer.I would reccommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Old reliable
Reviews.Author: Sky
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for two, nearly three years and have absolutely no trouble with it.  I leave it on automatic setting and just focus, point and click.  The picture quality is excellent.  It is light and easy to hold steady.  I bought it after comparing picture quality on the web.  I am never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: No he recibido informacion importante
Reviews.Author: gabriela jimenez
Reviews.Content: No me ha sido posible obtener información acerca del numero de tracking de mi paquete, en este sentido estoy muy descontenta dado que el dinero si fue recibido por el vendedor, en reiteradas ocasiones he escrito al mismo para que me de alguna información al respecto y no he recibido nada. lo unico que logre obtener fue la factura y por equivocación.agradezco de ser posible me envien información porque de otra forma gestionare el reclamo en el tiempo que establecen sus politicas de compra.

Reviews.Title: like it
Reviews.Author: Beech
Reviews.Content: don't take too many pics but does adequate job.  probably could be more creative with it, but not really from the always shooting generation

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: A. Breslow
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera and from the very first picture I knew it was the wrong choice. The pictures were blurry and the color was off. I played with the settings, which improved the quality slightly. I returned the FE 47 and got a different (a little more expensive) camera. I do not believe the low price is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Poor designed camera, shame for Olympus!
Reviews.Author: ZB
Reviews.Content: I bought it as birthday present to my doughter and she just returnedd from trip very disapointed with this camera.This camera can make only 35 pictures with a battery. It reports battery as empty with voltage as high 1.38V. Also if you open door and take SD card out it forgets date and time. Than it keeps bugging you to set date and time. In order to save on cost of materials for this camera Olympus used cheap digital parts.I am trying to return it.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE-47 Disappoints
Reviews.Author: SEMichPerson
Reviews.Content: The lens extension/retraction mechanism failed in less than three weeks.Hopfully Olympus will honor their warranty, and not blame the customer.  (Sorry but I had to say that, I've had bad warranty experiences in the past.)Before it failed I only had one complaint, the user can't shift the selected "aperature + shutter speed" combination.  For example, if the camera selects "F5.6 @ 1/125", the user can't shift it to "F4 @ 1/250" in order to reduce depth-of-field.  I had wrongly assumed such shifting would be a normal part of a camera design.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ramish Rambarran "Venezuelan"
Reviews.Content: I have always bought Olymous cameras. This unit is packed with features, some which you may never even use. Great camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
14-megapixel resolution for high-quality, poster-size prints
5x optical zoom
AF tracking; Intelligent Auto
Advanced Face Detection and Creative Art Filters
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-47 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Silver)
